result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry E Kerkman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will issue supplement order regarding sex offender registry.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
May not have contact with victim or victim's family.  DOC shall promplty notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes:
AS OF 11/6/2015 - DOC will not be permitted from prohibiting contact between the deft and his son and step-daughter without permission of the court EXCEPT on an emergency basis. 
Huber allowed.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days or work performed.

supervisions.notes:
PRIOR SENTENCE VACATED.
Huber Allowed.
***AJOC - 2/11/16 - It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Deft shall turn himself into the jail on Feb 13th @ 6pm***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry E Kerkman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority of the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Deft shall turn himself into the jail on Feb 13th @ 6pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  Case brought to court on State's request that an amended JOC be done to include the following language - "It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes."  Deft is presently serving his sentence on the ELM.  Arguments heard.  Court does grant the State's request - JOC shall be amended to include the language - " It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes."  Deft shall turn himself into the jail on Feb 13th @ 6pm.
Hearing at 02-11-2016 11:30 am
Vacated on 12/1/15
To Judge Schroeder
from Atty Terry Rose responding to the State's correspondence re: ELM
from ADA Krejcarek requesting the JOC be amended to reflect all non working hours to be spent in the KCJ
Email from Clerk

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Deft wishes to surrender probation.  No comment by either side.  Motion to surrender probation is granted.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 9mos KCJ commencing forthwith.  Credit for 51 days.  Huber allowed.
By Facsimile
From Atty. Rose
TO state:  DOC will not be permitted from prohibiting contact between the deft and his son and step-daughter without permission of the court EXCEPT on an emergency basis.
Copy of email received from DOC re: Gerald Blain's preliminary findings
(3) letters received on deft's behalf

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Case brought back on defense motion to allow the deft to have contact with his own children.  Supervisor Ruth Donalds spoke on behalf of DOC.  Court amends the deft's conditions of probation to include - DOC will not be permitted from prohibiting contact between the deft and his son and step-daughter without permission of the court EXCEPT on an emergency basis.  Defense orally moves to revoke the deft's probation and proceed to sentencing today.  State is not in victim rights compliance; thus, sentencing cannot occur today.  Atty Rose to file a written motion to revoke probation.  MH/sentencing set for 12/1/15 @ 1:30pm
from the Court to Atty Terry Rose responding to his correspondence of 10/23/15
To Judge Schroeder from Atty. Rose
from Atty Terry Rose - received Order to Register as a Sex Offender - no time limit was set; requests a period of 1yr
by Facsimile - NMM faxed to DA's office & Probation office
to allow contact between and his children
to Register as a Sex Offender
from defense counsel - requesting the court allow the deft contact w/his children, age 19, age 15, and age 22.  Probation agent is prohibiting contact
Bond applied; partial refund.  jk/cp  ck# 15CH075037
From Journey Church
Amended Info
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  Victim rights compliance.  Amended misd. information filed.  State moves to orally strike the DOB from the amended information; no objection by the defense.  Motion to strike the DOB of the complaining witness is granted.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Statement made by victim's father.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  Court will issue supplemental order regarding sex offender registry.  Deft to commence his conditional jail time on 10/31/15 @ 6pm.
To Clerk from Atty. Rose
Email to Clerk from Atty. Rose
Jury Selection outside Kenosha based on newspaper article (no date/time inserted in motion)
for jury selection outside Kenosha based on newspaper article

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  Atty Terry Rose reports the deft has decided not to accept the plea offer.  Leave on for JS 10/12/15 @ 9am.  Ludwig hrg held.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  Victim rights compliance.  Defense reports the case is not resolved; State requests a short adjournment to speak w/complaining witness.  FPT set for 10/2/15 @ 9:15am.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  Parties are close to a resolution; another FPT set for 9/29/15 @ 10:30am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  State objects to the court's motion to dismiss; brief arguments heard.  Court will deny its own motion to dismiss; but the State should be of the court's position regarding complaints which contain lengthly dialogue that is not necessary or required.  Discussion held on the other acts motion.  Court w/holds a ruling on the other acts motion but the bias is towards allowing the evidence in with regards to the complaining witness but denying the evidence with regards to the stepchild in the case-in-chief.  FPT 9/21/15 @ 1:15pm.
Motion hearing at 08-19-2015 11:00 am
on Court's own motion to determine whether allegations immaterial to the essential facts should be stricken

Amended Witness List and  Demand for Discovery

Jury selection at 10-12-2015 09:00 am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  State not ready to proceed; unavailability of witness.  State to file an amended witness list.  JS adj to 9/21/15 @ 9am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  Case is not resolved.  Arguments heard on State's motion to admit other acts; defense objects to the motion.  Motion taken under advisement with a bias to admitting the other acts associated with the complaining witness.  State will need to provide add'l documentation/evidence to the court.  State will also need to clarify the date(s) of the other acts.  Arguments heard on State's bond motion.  Defense objects.  State's motion denied at this time with leave to renew if add'l documentation is provided.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.
to Admit Other Evidence of Other Crimes, Wrongs, or Acts - filed by the State

Scheduling Order

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Terry Rose. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-10-15 @ 2:30pm. Jury selection on 7-20-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before   Commissioner on 5-8-15 @ 8:30 am.  $10,000.00  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). Refund balance posted $25,000.00.
